did.head: Collection Summary

descriptivenote.p: Collection material in English. Some material, especially from overseas press, is in French, German, and other languages.

corpname.part: Moving Image Research Center, National Audio-Visual Conservation Center, Library of Congress

did.abstract: The Jerry Lewis Papers consist of scripts and sketch material; memos and other correspondence; itineraries; business and legal papers; photographic prints, proof sheets, and negatives; press clippings and publicity; and other materials related to the film and television career of comedian, actor, and filmmaker Jerry Lewis, primarily from the period following the breakup of the act he formed with singer and comedian Dean Martin. Also included are papers related to Lewis's work with the Muscular Dystrophy Association's annual telethon, and his teaching work at the University of Southern California.
did.physloc: A1578-A1688 (boxes 1-111); L0082-L0090 (oversize boxes 112-120); C0387-C0393 (oversize boxes 121-127); D0031-D0076 (oversize boxes 128-173); E0015-E0061 (oversize boxes 174-220)

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The Jerry Lewis Papers were processed by David Jackson in 2020-2021.

separatedmaterial.head: Transfers
separatedmaterial.p: Musical scores have been transferred to the Music Division where they are identified as part of the Jerry Lewis collection.

separatedmaterial.head: Other Repositories
separatedmaterial.p: Jerry Lewis donated papers related to his film career to the University of Southern California in 1969, where they reside as part of the Cinematic Arts Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Material Cataloged Separately
relatedmaterial.p: Film and video recordings from the Jerry Lewis Collection have been incorporated into the moving image collections of the Library of Congress Moving Image Section. For additional information, contact a reference librarian in the Moving Image Research Center, National Audio-Visual Conservation Center, Library of Congress, Washington, DC, 20540-4690; (202) 707-8572.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: Restrictions may exist on copying, quoting, or publishing material included in the collection. For additional information, contact a reference librarian in the Moving Image Research Center, Motion Picture, National Audio-Visual Conservation Center, Library of Congress, Washington, DC, 20540-4690; (202) 707-8572.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The Jerry Lewis Papers are open to research. Select material may be restricted based on the presence of personal or sensitive information. Advance notice is required; contact a reference librarian in the Moving Image Research Center, National Audio-Visual Conservation Center, Library of Congress, Washington, DC, 20540-4690; (202) 707-8572.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: [Container number, eg., Box 3], Jerry Lewis Collection, National Audio-Visual Conservation Center, Library of Congress

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Comedian, actor, and filmaker Jerry Lewis was born Joseph Levitch in Newark, New Jersey, Mar. 16, 1926. Beginning in 1946, his partner act with Dean Martin, popularly known as Martin and Lewis, were successively among the most popular entertainers in nightclubs, radio, film, and television. Following a professional breakup with Martin, Jerry Lewis embarked on a solo film and television career from 1957-1971. During this period, Lewis increased the scope of his work to include screenwriting, directing, and producing, becoming the total filmmaker, as summed up in his monograph of that title. Sporadic film roles resumed in 1980. Later in his career, Lewis made a critically acclaimed transition to the stage, playing the devil in the Broadway revival of Damn Yankees, beginning in 1995. He died August 20, 2017.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Jerry Lewis Papers consist of scripts and sketch material; memos and other correspondence; itineraries; business and legal papers; photographic prints, proof sheets, and negatives; press clippings and publicity; and other materials related to the film and television career of comedian, actor, and filmmaker Jerry Lewis, primarily from the period following the breakup of the act he formed with singer and comedian Dean Martin. Also included are papers related to Lewis's work with the Muscular Dystrophy Association's annual telethon, and his teaching work at the University of Southern California.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Jerry Lewis Papers are organized in 7 series:

item.ref: Series I. Motion Pictures Scripts and Production Materials, 1958-1982
Series II. Television Scripts and Production Materials, 1960-1970
Series IV. Office Files and Correspondence, 1956-1999

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the LC Catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically.
